alert.note: Alert for Guam (Guam) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 17 at 4:37AM ChST until January 17 at 6:00PM ChST by NWS Guam
info.description: ...GUSTY WINDS AND DRY CONDITIONS WILL LEAD TO RAPID FIRE SPREAD... ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM THIS EVENING FOR A HIGH WIND EVENT... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... The National Weather Service in Tiyan has issued a Red Flag Warning, which is in effect until 6 PM this evening. * WIND...Sustained northeast winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts to 50 mph likely. * HUMIDITY...As low as 50 to 55 percent in the afternoons. * HIGHEST THREAT...Southern parts of Guam, especially areas with extensive sun and wind exposure. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A fire weather watch means that critical fire weather conditions are forecast to occur. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings. A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create ideal conditions for rapid spread of wildfires.
